result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javier Rogelio Salgado

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.
JusticePoint Services Violation Report (missed phone contact), filed.

Defendant Javier Rogelio Salgado in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. Defendant does not appear in person. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Court orders Justice Point Supervision reinstated. Case adjourned to Branch 35 IN PERSON.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
JusticePoint Services Violation Report (missed office contact), filed.

Defendant Javier Rogelio Salgado in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 35 IN PERSON.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Motion for Speedy Trial and Substitution of Judge.  (Javier R. Salgado - #2022003405, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

22RM016111  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
3/23/2022

Court ordered no contact with Rebecca G.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Javier Rogelio Salgado in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Javier Rogelio Salgado in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Javier Rogelio Salgado not in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/9/22 @ 2:30p
